intro: Cryptantha hypsophila, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, often in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
